subject: Re: [junit] Fast and slow tests
msgSnippet: ... I personally use: fast standalone, slow standalone, integration. There isn t much overlap between them. And usually, I only run the fast standalone tests
messageBody:
On 30/11/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> Integration and unit tests are actually not mutually exclusive with fast and
> slow tests. Here is an example:

I personally use: fast standalone, slow standalone, integration. There
isn't much overlap between them. And usually, I only run the fast
standalone tests manually - the other tests are run by CruiseControl.

This is the dichtomy that I present: there are tests that developers
run, and then there are the extra ones done by the build server.
Developers don't run the latter en masse, but only individually. At
least, that's how I set things up.
